result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse O Mireles was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs to be paid to Ozaukee County Clerk of Courts. Failure to pay will result in one day in jail for every $25 outstanding.

Defendant to submit to random testing.  Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription. Defendant to submit DNA sample within 30 days. Defendant to attend counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
-3- days credit, if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Jesse O Mireles in court with attorney Kirk Bowden Obear.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls Sgt. Meyer, sworn & testified. Cross examination. State rests. Conditions set by court:  No use or possession of controlled substances unless valid prescription and in original containers.

Defendant Jesse O Mireles in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A. Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail. Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time.  Counsel waives reading of complaint. Def does not qualify for public defender. State requests $100 cash with conditions.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
